quest.name: A Sultana's Resolve
journal: Nanamo appears to be reassessing her plans.
objectives: Speak with Nanamo at the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Profit... The thought never even crossed my mind.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: But standing about lamenting my naivety will not do anyone any good. I shall consider my lesson learned, and press on.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Forename─are you perchance acquainted with any successful merchants? If my attempt at philanthropy is obliged to reap a profit, it would seem wise to consult someone with a knack for business.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Hm... Ordinarily, I would not trust any agent of the East Aldenard Trading Company─but if you hold this Hancock fellow in high esteem, I am content to be led by you. You may repay my faith by journeying to distant Kugane and speaking with him on my behalf.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Eager though I am to visit those shores, I have not the leisure for a lengthy sea voyage. Now, assuming you will travel as adventurers are wont to do, I shall await your report by the aetheryte in Ul'dah. A fair journey to you, Forename─and a swift one, if you please.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Forename! To what do I owe the pleasure? Or are you here on business?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: ...I beg your pardon? Her Grace the sultana would have my opinion on how best to invest the wealth of Ul'dah?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: My dear Forename... I have you to thank for this...recognition, I am sure. And I am flattered that you came to me. Truly flattered.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: But why settle for a lowly apprentice, when you could have the master! Upon matters of profit, there is no living soul better-qualified to advise Her Grace than Chairman Lolorito─a man whose morning “exertions” are said to fill his garderobe with gold!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I should be happy to arrange a meeting for you...say, at the Scions' former headquarters in Thanalan? The Waking Sands would seem a suitably neutral venue for negotiations, don't you think? Fare you well, Forename, and may your dealings prove fruitful!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: You will not find a shrewder merchant than Chairman Lolorito. Would that I could be present to witness the back-and-forth of your coming negotiations!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Did your merchant friend have any useful advice to share?

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: ...With Lolorito!? And you agreed to this!?

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I am well aware of his standing in the field of business. But I had hoped to keep the Monetarists at arm's length, and him in particular...

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: ...Nay. I cannot live in fear of the man. I must learn how to treat with him if I am to rule Ul'dah effectively.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Very well! I will meet with Lolorito. Let us go on ahead to the Waking Sands, and prepare for his coming.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: So this is where the Scions first congregated... I have heard many tales, but never had occasion to visit.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: To work, then. The hour of the meeting draws near, and I would gather my thoughts. Pray see to it that we have the appointed room to ourselves.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: <sigh> I fear it will be many years before I feel comfortable taking part in such negotiations.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text:
But I shall not complain. We have piqued Lolorito's interest and secured his invaluable expertise.
Thank you, Forename. I could not have done it without you.
